articles.headline: ‘I Don’t Need Lessons From You on Courage’: Pete Buttigieg Makes His Case
articles.snippet: On the Democratic debate stage Tuesday night, Mr. Buttigieg didn’t brag about his military service, but he did outflank his rivals.
articles.abstract: On the Democratic debate stage Tuesday night, Mr. Buttigieg didn’t brag about his military service, but he did outflank his rivals.
articles.lead_paragraph: The last time a Democratic presidential nominee was trying to unseat a Republican incumbent, he arrived at the podium at the Democratic National Convention to tout his military service, his strongest credential: “I’m John Kerry and I’m reporting for duty.”

articles.headline: The World Condemns Erdogan’s War on Kurds. But Turkey Applauds.
articles.snippet: Attacked abroad, and facing a raft of sanctions, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan may nevertheless be getting what he wants from Turkey’s invasion of Kurdish-held Syria.
articles.abstract: Attacked abroad, and facing a raft of sanctions, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan may nevertheless be getting what he wants from Turkey’s invasion of Kurdish-held Syria.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — A raft of new American sanctions. An embargo on European arms sales. The indictment of a state-owned Turkish bank. Threats to isolate Turkey within NATO. A rise in global sympathy for the Kurdish cause. And the Syrian Army back in northern Syria.

articles.headline: Trump’s China Deal Leaves the Global Economy as Uncertain as Ever
articles.snippet: A trade truce with China has done little to reduce the uncertainty that threatens the global economy
articles.abstract: A trade truce with China has done little to reduce the uncertainty that threatens the global economy
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s trade truce with China may have temporarily cooled tensions between the world’s two largest economies. But the damage from Mr. Trump’s aggressive approach to trade policy will continue to weigh on the global economy.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: Peter Navarro Invented an Expert for His Books, Based on Himself
articles.snippet: President Trump’s trade adviser frequently cited Ron Vara, a fictional source who was a critic of China, in his writings.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s trade adviser frequently cited Ron Vara, a fictional source who was a critic of China, in his writings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Peter Navarro, a top White House trade adviser, has developed a reputation in Washington as a Rasputin-like China hawk who whispers anti-China musings in President Trump’s ear.

articles.headline: Trump’s Impeachment Blockade Crumbles as Witnesses Agree to Talk
articles.snippet: After vowing not to cooperate with a “kangaroo court,” the president has largely failed to prevent current and former administration members from spending hours with Democrats seeking to impeach him.
articles.abstract: After vowing not to cooperate with a “kangaroo court,” the president has largely failed to prevent current and former administration members from spending hours with Democrats seeking to impeach him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House’s trenchant declaration to House impeachment investigators last week was unequivocal: No more witnesses or documents for a “totally compromised kangaroo court.”
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: A Brexit Deal in Hand, Boris Johnson Faces an Uphill Struggle in Parliament
articles.snippet: Britain’s prime minister cited a “great new deal that takes back control,” hours after a Northern Irish party rejected the agreement.
articles.abstract: Britain’s prime minister cited a “great new deal that takes back control,” hours after a Northern Irish party rejected the agreement.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Britain and the European Union agreed on a Brexit deal Thursday, setting the stage for a fateful showdown in the British Parliament, where Prime Minister Boris Johnson faces an uphill struggle to marshal enough votes for his plan after three years of anguished, politically corrosive debate.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Stephen Castle

articles.headline: A Scotch Maker’s Challenge: First Brexit. Now Tariffs.
articles.snippet: The 25 percent U.S. tariffs to be imposed Friday are causing headaches for single malt distilleries, already struggling with Brexit.
articles.abstract: The 25 percent U.S. tariffs to be imposed Friday are causing headaches for single malt distilleries, already struggling with Brexit.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAY, Scotland — Britain’s planned departure from the European Union has turned distiller Anthony Wills’s workdays into a marathon of logistics.

articles.headline: Elijah Cummings, Powerful Democrat Who Investigated Trump, Dies at 68
articles.snippet: A son of sharecroppers, he fought tirelessly for his hometown, Baltimore, and became a key figure in the impeachment investigation of President Trump.
articles.abstract: A son of sharecroppers, he fought tirelessly for his hometown, Baltimore, and became a key figure in the impeachment investigation of President Trump.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and David Stout

articles.headline: Turkey Agrees to Pause Fighting, but Not to Withdraw Forces From Northern Syria
articles.snippet: After talks in Ankara, Vice President Mike Pence said the agreement would ‘‘save lives,’’ while Turkey said ‘‘we got what we wanted.’’
articles.abstract: After talks in Ankara, Vice President Mike Pence said the agreement would ‘‘save lives,’’ while Turkey said ‘‘we got what we wanted.’’
articles.lead_paragraph: ANKARA, Turkey — Vice President Mike Pence on Thursday agreed to a deal with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan that accepted a Turkish military presence in a broad part of northern Syria in exchange for the promise of a five-day cease-fire, completing an abrupt reversal of American policy in the Syrian conflict.
articles.byline: By Annie Karni, Lara Jakes and Patrick Kingsley
